data.quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; Fools because they have to say something.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Courage is knowing what not to fear.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Music is the movement of sound to reach the soul for the education of its virtue.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Thinking: the talking of the soul with itself.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: A good decision is based on knowledge and not on numbers.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Let parents bequeath to their children not riches, but the spirit of reverence.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Opinion is the medium between knowledge and ignorance.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Music is a moral law. It gives soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination, and charm and gaiety to life and to everything.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: The beginning is the most important part of the work.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Honesty is for the most part less profitable than dishonesty.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: The direction in which education starts a man will determine his future in life.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Good people do not need laws to tell them to act responsibly, while bad people will find a way around the laws.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Dictatorship naturally arises out of democracy, and the most aggravated form of tyranny and slavery out of the most extreme liberty.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: A hero is born among a hundred, a wise man is found among a thousand, but an accomplished one might not be found even among a hundred thousand men.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: No law or ordinance is mightier than understanding.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: This City is what it is because our citizens are what they are.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: For a man to conquer himself is the first and noblest of all victories.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Rhetoric is the art of ruling the minds of men.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: The measure of a man is what he does with power.
data.author: Plato
